title: Business & Finance
text:
Several top executives at Lordstown Motors sold off chunks of stock in the electric-truck startup ahead of reporting financial results, according to filings disclosing the transactions.

---

The Fed's Powell said job growth should pick up in coming months and temporary inflation pressures should ease as the economy continues to recover from the effects of the pandemic.

---

U.S. stocks rallied, with the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq advancing 1.8%, 1.4% and 0.8%, respectively.

---

The SEC is preparing to require public companies to disclose more information about how they respond to threats linked to climate change.

---

The chip shortage is pushing up prices of items such as laptops and printers and threatening to do the same to other top-selling devices.

---

Steven Spielberg struck a multiyear deal to make movies for Netflix, a huge get for the streaming giant as it faces increased competition.

---

Poultry giant Sanderson Farms is exploring a sale as the demand for chicken products rises.

---

JPMorgan said it had acquired Campbell Global, which manages $5.3 billion of timberland on behalf of institutional investors.
